subject: P4 Science
global_instructions: For each question from 1 to 9, four options are given. One of them is the correct answer. Make your choice (1, 2, 3 or 4) and shade your answer on the Optical Answer Sheet.

questions.main_question_text: The diagram below shows the human digestive system.

diagram_info.diagram_description: A diagram showing the human digestive system with parts labeled A, B, C, and D. A points to the mouth, B to the stomach, C to the pancreas, and D to the small intestine.

parts.question_text: Which of the following statements is correct?
options: Digestion is completed in part C.
No digestion takes place in part A.
No digestive juice is found in part B.
Digested food is absorbed into the blood in part D.
parts.correct_answer: Digested food is absorbed into the blood in part D.

questions.main_question_text:
Study the table below on human body systems.
Which of the following is correct?

diagram_info.diagram_description: A table detailing four options, each with a body system, an organ, and its function.

options: Skeletal | Brain | To protect our main organs.
Muscular | Muscles | To give our body its shape.
Circulatory | Heart | To pump blood to the rest of the body.
Respiratory | Blood | To transport waste materials away from different parts of the body.
parts.correct_answer: Circulatory | Heart | To pump blood to the rest of the body.

questions.main_question_text:
A, B, C, D and E are organs in the digestive system. The graph below shows the amount of undigested food leaving each organ after a meal.
Which of the following is correct?

diagram_info.diagram_description: A bar graph showing the amount of undigested food leaving each of the five organs labeled B, C, D, and E on the x-axis.

options: Mouth: A, Gullet: D, Small Intestine: B, Large Intestine: E
Mouth: B, Gullet: C, Small Intestine: D, Large Intestine: A
Mouth: E, Gullet: B, Small Intestine: C, Large Intestine: D
Mouth: B, Gullet: E, Small Intestine: A, Large Intestine: D
parts.correct_answer: Mouth: B, Gullet: C, Small Intestine: D, Large Intestine: A

questions.main_question_text: Alex and Kaylyn made the following statements about substance X which is in a container.

diagram_info.diagram_description: A diagram showing a beaker with substance X, and two children, Alex and Kaylyn, with speech bubbles stating that substance X is a solid and a liquid respectively.

parts.question_text: Which of the following tests can help determine which student is correct?
options: To find out if substance X has mass.
To find out if substance X can be compressed.
To find out if substance X has a definite shape.
To find out if substance X has a definite volume.

questions.main_question_text: An experiment was set up as shown below using a sealed metal container which holds 60 cm³ of water and 30 cm³ of air. 10 cm³ of water was removed from the container through the tap.

diagram_info.diagram_description: A diagram of a sealed metal container with 60 cm³ of water and 30 cm³ of air, equipped with a pump and a tap.

parts.question_text: Which of the following correctly shows the amount of air in the container at the end of the experiment and the explanation of the results?
options: 30 cm³ | Air can be compressed.
30 cm³ | Air has no definite volume.
40 cm³ | Air can be compressed.
40 cm³ | Air has no definite volume.

questions.main_question_text:
The diagram below shows two objects, X and Y, placed on a beam balance.

Based on the observation above, which statement is correct?

diagram_info.diagram_description: A diagram showing two objects, X and Y, on a beam balance. Object X is larger and lower than object Y, indicating it has a greater mass.

options: Y has a greater mass than X.
Y has a greater volume than X.
Both X and Y are made of the same material.
Objects with smaller mass, have smaller volume.

questions.main_question_text: Which one of the following is a source of light?

diagram_info.diagram_description: Four images are shown as options: a lit lamp, a mirror, an apple, and the moon.

options: a lit lamp
a mirror
an apple
the moon

questions.main_question_text: Kaelyn conducted an experiment and realised that she can see light through the holes of the cardboards when they are aligned. However, when one of the cardboards is shifted slightly, she no longer sees the light.

diagram_info.diagram_description: A diagram showing an experiment with a torchlight, three cardboards with holes, and an observer named Kaelyn. It demonstrates that light travels in a straight line, as the light can only be seen when the holes are aligned.

parts.question_text: Which is the correct reason for her observation?
options: Light can be reflected.
Light cannot be blocked.
Light is a form of energy.
Light travels in a straight line.
parts.correct_answer: Light travels in a straight line.

diagram_info.diagram_description: A diagram showing a person named Darwin looking at a picture on an easel. A lamp hanging from the ceiling provides light.

parts.question_text: How is Darwin able to see the picture?
options: The picture gives off light and enters his eyes.
The light reflects the picture and enters his eyes.
The light enters his eyes and reflects on the picture.
The light falls on the picture and gets reflected into his eyes.
parts.correct_answer: The light falls on the picture and gets reflected into his eyes.

global_instructions: For questions 10 to 14, write your answers in the spaces provided.
The number of marks available is shown in bracket [ ] at the end of each question or part question.
